overview: The measure has been amended to establish legally sufficient standards for the awarding of grants, a change made to address constitutional concerns raised in testimony (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). This version of the bill formalizes the application and compliance requirements for homeowners and homebuyers seeking funds. The program's core purpose remains the same: to provide grants for Accessory Dwelling Unit construction in exchange for a perpetual, county-owned deed restriction ensuring the property is occupied by local workers (HB740_HD2).
agency_impact: In response to testimony from the Department of the Attorney General, the measure was amended to include specific standards for grant awards to ensure the proper use of public funds (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). The bill was also amended to clarify that the conveyance tax exemption applies to the instrument conveying the deed restriction itself, addressing comments from the Department of Taxation (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). The Department of Taxation's request for a January 1, 2026 effective date for the tax exemption was noted by the committee, but the bill's defective effective date remains unchanged (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_).
policy_impact: The measure now incorporates specific legal standards for grant applications and administration, formalizing the process to comply with state constitutional requirements for grants of public money (HB740_HD2). The policy regarding the conveyance tax exemption has been clarified to explicitly cover the document that conveys the deed restriction to the county (HB740_HD2). These amendments strengthen the legal and administrative framework of the program.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The bill was amended to incorporate legally sufficient standards for grant awards, addressing a key concern previously raised by the Department of the Attorney General (HB740_HD2_HSCR617_). Additionally, the conveyance tax exemption was clarified to explicitly include the document conveying the deed restriction, a change made in response to agency feedback (HB740_HD2).
